[Code Repository](https://github.com/CINERGI)

Capabilities: cross-disciplinary data discovery, registration, curation, visualization, metadata augmentation (keywords, spatial, org)
Technology: REST for semantic processing using SciGraph, oData viewer, ontologies (SWEET, ENVO, YAGO, CHEBI, GCMD, GeoSciML, Geochronology, EDAM)
Standards: standardize metadata schemas (ISO 19115 / 19139), PROV (provenance), standardized interfaces (for search: CSW, ESRI Geoportal REST, Open Search, SOLR REST)
Domains:
Repositories: IEDA
Projects: CHORDS, ECITE, GeoWS
Resource Types: Documents, catalogs, vocabularies, data models, data services, process models, information repositories, domain-specific ontologies

Capabilities: cross-disciplinary data discovery, registration, curation, visualization, metadata augmentation (keywords, spatial, org)

Standards: standardize metadata schemas (ISO 19115 / 19139), PROV (provenance), standardized interfaces (for search: CSW, ESRI Geoportal REST, Open Search, SOLR REST)

Repositories:
Projects: IEDA, CHORDS, ECITE, GeoWS
Resource Types:

old.desc:
Contact: [Elisha Wood-Charlson](mailto:elishawc@hawaii.edu)

[NSF Award Page](http://nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1440066&HistoricalAwards=false)

[Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22ECOGEO%22+EarthCube&btnG=&hl=en&as_sdt=0%2C6)

Anyone looking to use omics tools to answer research questions
Major outcomes of ECOGEO RCN will be: 
-Establishment of a virtual network that coordinates collaboration and communication in omics, data sharing and analyses;
-Training of a cyber-savvy generation of ocean and geo science graduate students, postdocs and young professionals in the rapidly evolving environmental omics and bioinformatics field.
-Identification and elaboration of environmental omic data standards, ontologies, sharing mechanisms, and analytical strategies;
-)Development of use case scenarios that will inspire creation of a new palette of user friendly inter-operative community data management, analytical and visualization tools for oceanography and geobiology omic science and beyond.

[YouTube Playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0dptnyHCxLBH7C_QRsad64rQLrJvclS2)

[Sci-Tech Matchup video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jpUBgLwaym0)

[Main Website](http://ncar.github.io/chords/)

[Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22CHORDS%22+earthcube&btnG=&hl=en&as_sdt=0%2C6)

Cloud-Hosted Real-time Data Services for the Geosciences (CHORDS) is a real-time data services infrastructure that will provide an easy-to-use system to acquire, navigate and distribute real-time data streams via cloud services and the Internet. It will lower the barrier to these services for small instrument teams, employ data and metadata formats that adhere to community accepted standards, and broaden access to real-time data for the geosciences community.

Scientists who would like to manage their real-time data online and provide them in standard formats; Scientists who would like to use real-time data in their experiments.

[Phys.org News story](https://phys.org/news/2016-06-geosciences-team-gps-sensors-tanzanian.html)

card.name: CHORDS
card.desc:
Contact: [Mike Daniels](mailto:daniels@ucar.edu)

[NSF Award Page](http://nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1440133&HistoricalAwards=false)

[Main Website](http://ncar.github.io/chords/)

[Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22CHORDS%22+earthcube&btnG=&hl=en&as_sdt=0%2C6)

Cloud-Hosted Real-time Data Services for the Geosciences (CHORDS) is a real-time data services infrastructure that will provide an easy-to-use system to acquire, navigate and distribute real-time data streams via cloud services and the Internet. It will lower the barrier to these services for small instrument teams, employ data and metadata formats that adhere to community accepted standards, and broaden access to real-time data for the geosciences community.

Scientists who would like to manage their real-time data online and provide them in standard formats; Scientists who would like to use real-time data in their experiments.

[Phys.org News story](https://phys.org/news/2016-06-geosciences-team-gps-sensors-tanzanian.html)

[Sci-Tech Matchup video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z7kbiCZn8h0)

**AWARDS**

[NSF Award 1343802](https://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1343802&HistoricalAwards=false)

NSF Award 1343802 Investigators: [Siri Khalsa](mailto:khalsa@colorado.edu), [Stefano Nativi](mailto:stefano.nativi@cnr.it), [Ruth Duerr](mailto:ruth.duerr@ronininstitute.org), [Francoise Pearlman](mailto:jsp@sprintmail.com), [Jay Pearlman](mailto:jay.pearlman@jandfent.com)

[EC Group Website](https://www.earthcube.org/group/bcube)

[Code Repository](https://github.com/b-cube/)

**PROPERTIES**

Capabilities: crawling, brokering, semantics, data access

Technologies: Cloud-based, brokering API, SPARQL endpoint, crawler uses Nutch, Solr, Elastic map reduce, AWS, looks for XML, converted to triples 
using ontologies, "RESTparql" to query triple store.  

Standards: 

Domains: Ocean, hydrology, weather, cryosphere

Data Providers: OOI, USGS Hyrax OPeNDAP Server, NSIDC

Related Projects: 

Resource Types:
